main_definition: Unchanging or consistent in condition, level, or rate over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Consistently reliable and stable; not easily swayed by changes or challenges.
meanings_and_examples.example: The steady growth of the economy has led to more job opportunities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Firmly fixed in position, not moving or shaking.
meanings_and_examples.example: He held onto the railing steadily as he climbed down the stairs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Persistently maintaining a certain level of performance or quality.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her steady grades throughout high school reflected her dedication to academics.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unwaveringly committed to something, such as a course of action or belief.
meanings_and_examples.example: She remained steadfast in her support for the environmental cause despite opposition.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not fluctuating or changing rapidly; steady in behavior or temperament.
meanings_and_examples.example: Even under pressure, he stayed steady and composed during his presentation.
